answerText: John Maxwell Coetzee [10] This Coetzee novel describes the title character's travels from Cape Town with his mother, Anna. She dies in a hospital, after which the protagonist gets impressed into a work gang and eventually flees into the mountains.

question: Question: One of his novels has been adapted into an opera by Philip Glass and another is scheduled to be adapted into a 2010 opera by Nicholas Lens.  [10] Name this Nobel-Prize winning author of Waiting for the Barbarians and a novel about the Romantic literature professor David Lurie, Disgrace.
